intro: Nuttallia cronquistii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble dandelions. The plant has basal leaves that are oblanceolate and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a single head. Nuttallia cronquistii is adapted to arid environments, with a deep root system that allows it to survive in dry conditions. It plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and provides nectar for pollinators.
